name: MIMOSA - MachInes and MethOds for the harvest of nutS in Agroforestry
description_brief: The mimosa tool is intended to support (future) nut producers in selecting the appropriate machinery for their system, taking into consideration the scale and (future) production, and aiming af tinding the right balance between available (manual) labour and investing in mechanisation
developers: Martijn Taelman, Bert Reubens, Julian Rahahleh
organizations: Flanders research institute for agriculture, fisheries and food (ILVO), Soil Service of Belgium (BDB)
description_full: The mimosa tool is intended to support (future) nut producers in selecting the appropriate machinery for their system, taking into consideration the scale and (future) production, and aiming af tinding the right balance between available (manual) labour and investing in mechanisation
minimum_req: Cross-platform tool (works in Windows, Mac and Linux)
input_data_protocols: User enters the data directly manually
output_data_formats: Static content (e.g. reports on website pages, tables and graphs in the tool's interface, PDF files)
access_barrier: No, direct download/access through a web link
